intro: Dianthus fimbriatus var. brachyphyllus, commonly known as the dwarf fringed carnation, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, clustered flowers with fringed petals that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate appearance and ability to bloom throughout the summer months.
